page.title: 18MADELEY STAFFS :THE PAST NOW
page.content: No local history group exists here but individual enthusiasts find plenty of material-not always obvious-to work on. One account of Madeley parish from Saxon times until the 1960's has been written by Madeley College of Education staff,helped by many villagers. Place names are clues to past industry (brick & timber)dating from C15:Wharf Terrace,Saw Pit Yard,Mill Lane.During recent ploughing of a meadow after 100 years,traces of brick kilns & potsherds were found.Of 105 family names used in the C17,20 occur today.The past remains Interest usually centres on Heighley Castle,a low wall of stone on a height, which alone remains of several fortress -es on the site from Saxon times until the Civil War.The Audleys owned it from the C13.The Offley-Crewes owned Madeley land from the C16 until 1951.The last Manor House was built in 1820.
